uri.description: URI of the topic page for which you wish to retrieve matching events. Obtain the URI from the URL on the [monitoring page](https://eventregistry.org/monitoring) when the topic page is opened.

resultType.description: Define what kind of results you would like to get.

eventsPage.description: Determines the page of the results to return (starting from 1). Relevant when `resultType = events`.

eventsCount.description: Define how many events (up to 50) will be returned. Relevant when `resultType = events`.

eventsSortBy.description:
Set how you would like to sort your results. `date` (by event date), `rel` (relevance to the query), `size` (number of articles),
    `socialScore` (amount of shares in social media). Relevant when `resultType = events`.

eventsSortByAsc.description: Should the results be ordered in ascending order or descending order (default) based on the sorting criteria. Relevant when `resultType = events`.

includeEventTitle.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event title in the response.

includeEventSummary.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event summary in the response.

includeEventSocialScore.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event social score in the response.

includeEventSentiment.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event sentiment in the response.

includeEventLocation.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event location in the response.

includeEventDate.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event date in the response.

includeEventArticleCounts.description: Set this parameter to true to include the article counts for events in the response.

includeEventConcepts.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event concepts in the response.

includeEventCategories.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event categories in the response.

includeEventCommonDates.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event commmon dates in the response.

includeEventStories.description: Set this parameter to true to include the event stories in the response.

eventImageCount.description: Define how many images you would like to have in the response.

includeConceptLabel.description: Set this parameter to true to include the concept label in the response.

includeConceptImage.description: Set this parameter to true to include the concept image in the response.

includeConceptSynonyms.description: Set this parameter to true to include the concept synonyms in the response.

conceptLang.description: Define the language of the concept label.

includeStoryBasicStats.description: Set this parameter to true to include story basic stats in the response.

includeStoryTitle.description: Set this parameter to true to include the story title in the response.

includeStoryLocation.description: Set this parameter to true to include the story location in the response.

includeStoryDate.description: Set this parameter to true to include the story date in the response.

includeStoryConcepts.description: Set this parameter to true to include the story concepts in the response.

includeStoryCategories.description: Set this parameter to true to include the story categories in the response.

includeStoryMedoidArticle.description: Set this parameter to true to include story medoid article in the response.

includeStoryCommonDates.description: Set this parameter to true to include story common dates in the response.

storyImageCount.description: Define how many images you would like to have in the response.

includeCategoryParentUri.description: Set this parameter to true to include category parent uri in the response.

includeLocationPopulation.description: Set to true to include the population size of the location

includeLocationGeoNamesId.description: Set to true to include the GeoNames id of the location

includeLocationCountryArea.description: Set to true to include the are of the location in squared km.

includeLocationCountryContinent.description: Set to true to get the continent of the country for location objects.
